strong.font:
DUE TO PREDICTED RAIN, THE NORTHWOOD PARADE IS BEING RESCHEDULED FOR FRIDAY, MAY 1ST.
DETAILS TO FOLLOW.

br.font:
Hello Northwood Families:
We will be playing a Kahoot game during the Zoom Hangout Meetings. You will need a device other than the one you are using for the Zoom in order to participate. You can use another phone, laptop, or tablet.
Topic: Northwood Hangout
Time: Apr 21, 2020 07:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)
Every day, until Apr 23, 2020, 3 occurrence(s)
Apr 21, 2020 07:00 PM (K-2)
Apr 22, 2020 07:00 PM (3-5)
Apr 23, 2020 07:00 PM (6-8)
Join Zoom Meeting https://us04web.zoom.us/j/76077781726?pwd=cXZtWFlZeUwvYldQblJJZS9DS1d4UT09 Meeting ID: 760 7778 1726
Password: 3Dia1t

span.font: We hope you and your family are healthy and safe as you read this letter. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we have made adjustments to instructional delivery over the past 5 weeks. We are extremely appreciative of our students, families, teachers, staff, and administrators for their positivity, flexibility, and resilience during these trying times. Please review the updates and reminders listed below and reach out with any questions.

li.font: Distance Learning Survey: Our Distance Learning Survey is available starting today for families to share feedback and inform us of your technology access. You can find this survey, in addition to all Northwood correspondence, on our website. Please fill out this survey by Tuesday, April 28. We appreciate your feedback as we continue to improve and modify. As always, any technology question can be addressed at: tech@northwoodcs.org. PLEASE CLICK HERE TO COMPLETE SURVEY.

span.font: Staff Car Parade: Due to the predicted rain, our Northwood Family Parade has been rescheduled to Friday, May 1st starting at 11AM. We are so excited to see all of you who can make it. More information regarding the parade route will be shared prior to the event.

Distance Learning: Our teachers continue to work very hard to provide quality instruction for our students. Students - we hope that you are working hard every day, too. It is so essential for all students to complete work in all subject areas each day and watch all instructional videos. Students are given a daily assessment that will count toward their attendance and grades in each subject area. It is also important for students to put forth their best effort in their work; parents should not be completing work on behalf of their child. If you are ever confused about an assignment, be sure to watch all of the provided videos, attend your teachers’ office hours, and send emails if you have any additional questions.

8th Grade Closing Ceremonies and Class Dues: Thank you for your inquiries regarding Closing Ceremonies and class dues. We are currently looking at all options and will continue to inform you as decisions are made.

font.span:
Please note all rallies are being rescheduled
​NEW
ACTION STEPS CONCERNING THE GOVERNOR’S PROPOSED BUDGET CUTS

h2.font:
Thank you to all that have already written letters to their representatives and visited the 143k rising website to show their opposition to the Governor’s proposed budget cuts to Special Education funding. There are new action steps in place that could use your attention. A NEW online petition has been started specifically for Northwood. There is a paper version of this petition at the front office, or you can go to
​https://www.change.org/p/stop-governor-wolf-from-cutting-funding-for-northwood-s-students to sign the petition online.
All of these action steps are critical to our fight against these cuts,. We thank you for your time and support!
UPDATE– The Harrisburg rally previously scheduled for May 18th has been changed tentatively to May 4th. We will keep you posted as info. develops on this rally.

div.font:
The Northwood Academy Charter School (NACS) began operation in September of 2005. We are a K-8 program with a well-developed academic program that emphasizes comprehensive literacy and mathematical instruction in accordance with federal and local standards. Our instructional program is driven by state, local and commercial assessment results, school achievement and adherence with IEP requirements. Our mission is to prepare our children to take advantage of the wealth of educational opportunities that exist for them. To that end, Northwood has hired a dedicated, skilled instructional staff to guide them in the process. Every staff member is charged with the care and well-being of every child. We believe that all children are able to achieve regardless of their socio-economic status, race, ability level or past academic experience. By respecting and supporting our students, their families and our staff on a regular basis, we honor and uphold this belief.
​

strong.a: Please visit our coronavirus/COVID-19 resource page for up to date information.
